result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DeAngelo Burton Weathersby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety.  vp
Dispo entered.

Defendant DeAngelo Burton Weathersby in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant DeAngelo Burton Weathersby in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read in as to sentencing on case 14cm4776./ lr
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. LR  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant DeAngelo Burton Weathersby not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defense motion to modify bail argued and granted by the Court. Bail: $200.00 CASH TO REMAIN AND ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF BAIL..

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Walmart

Defendant DeAngelo Burton Weathersby in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant DeAngelo Burton Weathersby in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
